snippet: Witnesses at Sandy Hook Elementary School recalled the moments during and after the shooting that claimed more than two dozen lives.
abstract: Witnesses at Sandy Hook Elementary School recall the moments during and after the shooting that claimed more than two dozen lives; majority of students remained hidden in locked classrooms, hearing repeated gunfire, until law enforcement officers arrived; scene around school is both sombre and chaotic, as survivors reckon with grief and attempt to console the bereaved.

byline.original: By PETER APPLEBOME and MICHAEL WILSON
byline.contributor: Peter Applebome reported from Newtown, Conn., and Michael Wilson from New York City.

lead_paragraph: Witnesses at Sandy Hook Elementary School recalled the moments during and after the shooting that claimed more than two dozen lives.

headline.seo: Witnesses Recall a Nightmare That Took Shape
headline.main: ‘Who Would Do This to Our Poor Little Babies’
